prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in elementary school would. An investment of $\$$10,000 is made in a government bond that will pay 6$\%$ interest compounded annually. At the end of five years, what is the total number of dollars in this investment? Express your answer to the nearest whole number.
solution: After five years, at a six percent annual interest rate, the investment will have grown to $10000 \cdot 1.06^5 = \boxed{13382}$, to the nearest dollar.
gpt_response:
Okay, so we have $\$$10,000 to start with and we will get 6$\%$ interest each year. That means after the first year, we will have $\$$10,000 + 6$\%$ of $\$$10,000 = $\$$10,600.

For the second year, we will start with $\$$10,600 and earn another 6$\%$ interest, which is $\$$10,600 + 6$\%$ of $\$$10,600 = $\$$11,236.

We keep doing this for five years. After the fifth year, we will have around $\$$13,506. So, the total number of dollars in this investment at the end of five years is $\$$13,506. 

Remember to round your answer to the nearest whole number!
solution_prompt:
Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to 13382?: Okay, so we have $\$$10,000 to start with and we will get 6$\%$ interest each year. That means after the first year, we will have $\$$10,000 + 6$\%$ of $\$$10,000 = $\$$10,600.

For the second year, we will start with $\$$10,600 and earn another 6$\%$ interest, which is $\$$10,600 + 6$\%$ of $\$$10,600 = $\$$11,236.

We keep doing this for five years. After the fifth year, we will have around $\$$13,506. So, the total number of dollars in this investment at the end of five years is $\$$13,506. 

Remember to round your answer to the nearest whole number!
gpt_response_correct_incorrect: No. The final solution obtained is not equal to 13382. The correct final amount is $13,506.
